intro: Antimima dolomitica, commonly known as the dolomitic antimima, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are fleshy and adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in dry environments. Antimima dolomitica is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, where it thrives in full sun.
